Subject: Re: [junit] test cases for inputs from file


> Jonathan Gossage wrote:
>
> >I get the same results as you do on 3.7 if I put in the synchronization
> >statements that I described in my previous post, otherwise I get the
results
> >that I described there. There is a complex test fixture involved here as
> >well as a smart card monitor thread in the classes under test, but it is
> >easy to distinguish the messages from the monitor thread from the
messages
> >from the test cases themselves.
> >
>
> I assume your testXXX() methods invoke methods that spawn threads and
> your logging statements are in those methods under test, correct?
>
> My point is that JUnit out of the box does not spawn threads for
> testXXX() methods.
>
> Mike
>
I think I may have found where the confusion arose. These tests are being
run in the TestRunner supplied with JBuilber 6 which may be starting
threads. I agree that there is no way that the standard Junit code should
exhibit this behaviour. At the very least each SetUp(), testXXX(), and
tearDown() sequence should run in the same thread, although if you use the
GUI based test runners it appears that each suite is started in a separate
thread.

Regards

Jonathan Gossage

Email address: jonathan@...
